greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of standard Young tableaux for partitions of n into distinct parts with largest part <= k; triangle A(n,k), k>=0, 0<=n<=k*(k+1)/2, read by columns.
comment: A(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  A(n,k) = 0 iff n > k*(k+1)/2 = A000217(k). The triangle contains only the nonzero terms.  A(n,k) = A(n,n) for k>=n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Columns k = 0..22, flattened
maple: h:= proc(l) local n; n:=nops(l); add(i, i=l)!/mul(mul(1+l[i]-j+
g:= proc(n, i, l) local s; s:=i*(i+1)/2;
mathematica: h[l_] := With[{n=Length[l]}, Total[l]!/Product[Product[1+l[[i]]-j+Sum[If[ l[[k]] >= j, 1, 0], {k, i+1, n}], {j, 1, l[[i]]}], {i, 1, n}]];
g[n_, i_, l_] := g[n, i, l] = With[{s=i*(i+1)/2}, If[n==s, h[Join[l, Table[ i-j, {j, 0, i-1}]]], If[n>s, 0, g[n, i-1, l] + If[i>n, 0, g[n-i, i-1, Append[l, i]]]]]];
Table[Table[A[n, k], {n, 0, k*(k+1)/2}], {k, 0, 7}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 29 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Column of leftmost nonzero element is A002024(n) for n>0.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 17 2012
